name: ssl-baseline
title: DevSec SSL/TLS Baseline
summary: Ensures a secure configuration for TCP ports
copyright: DevSec Hardening Framework Team & Chef Software Inc.

controls.title: Inspec::Version=2.3.10
controls.code:
control 'debugging' do
  title "Inspec::Version=#{Inspec::VERSION}"
  impact 0.0
  describe "tcpports=\n#{tcpports.join("\n")}" do
    it { should_not eq nil }
  end
  describe "sslports=\n#{sslports.join("\n")}" do
    it { should_not eq nil }
  end
end

controls.title: Disable SSL 2 from all exposed SSL ports.
controls.code:
control 'ssl2' do
  title 'Disable SSL 2 from all exposed SSL ports.'
  impact 1.0
  only_if { sslports.length > 0 }

  sslports.each do |sslport|
    # create a description
    proc_desc = "on node == #{target_hostname} running #{sslport[:socket].process.inspect} (#{sslport[:socket].pid})"
    describe ssl(sslport).protocols('ssl2') do
      it(proc_desc) { should_not be_enabled }
      it { should_not be_enabled }
    end
  end
end

controls.title: Enable ECDH as KX from all exposed SSL/TLS ports and versions.

    # create a description

      it(proc_desc) { should be_enabled }
      it { should be_enabled }
    end
  end
end

controls.title: Enable ECDSA or RSA as AU from all exposed SSL/TLS ports and versions.
controls.code:
control 'au-ecdsa-rsa' do
  title 'Enable ECDSA or RSA as AU from all exposed SSL/TLS ports and versions.'
  impact 0.5
  only_if { sslports.length > 0 }

  sslports.each do |sslport|
    # create a description
    proc_desc = "on node == #{target_hostname} running #{sslport[:socket].process.inspect} (#{sslport[:socket].pid})"
    describe ssl(sslport).ciphers(/(RSA|ECDSA)_WITH/i) do
      it(proc_desc) { should be_enabled }
      it { should be_enabled }
    end
  end
end

    describe ssl(sslport).ciphers(/WITH_(AES_256|AES_128|CHACHA20|AES_256_GCM|AES_128_GCM)/i) do
      it(proc_desc) { should be_enabled }
      it { should be_enabled }
    end
  end
end

controls.title: Return Of Bleichenbacher's Oracle Threat
controls.desc: ROBOT is the return of a 19-year-old vulnerability that allows performing RSA decryption and signing operations with the private key of a TLS server.

descriptions.default: ROBOT is the return of a 19-year-old vulnerability that allows performing RSA decryption and signing operations with the private key of a TLS server.

refs.ref: Paper: Return Of Bleichenbacher's Oracle Threat (ROBOT)

controls.code:
control 'robotattack' do
  title "Return Of Bleichenbacher's Oracle Threat"
  desc 'ROBOT is the return of a 19-year-old vulnerability that allows performing RSA decryption and signing operations with the private key of a TLS server.'
  ref "Paper: Return Of Bleichenbacher's Oracle Threat (ROBOT)", url: 'https://ia.cr/2017/1189'
  tag 'sslattack', 'tlsattack'
  impact 0.5
  only_if { sslports.length > 0 }

  sslports.each do |sslport|
    # create a description
    proc_desc = "on node == #{target_hostname} running #{sslport[:socket].process.inspect} (#{sslport[:socket].pid})"
    describe ssl(sslport).ciphers(/^TLS_RSA/i) do
      it(proc_desc) { should_not be_enabled }
      it { should_not be_enabled }
    end
  end
end

options.description: Array of IPv4 and IPv6 Addresses to exclude
Array of TCP ports to exclude from SSL checking
